If you have a constructor that initialises some variables then you can start
by checking that the variables are set correctly and of course you can
assert that the Object you just tried to construct isn't null.  The same
logic can be applied for void methods.  Of course if any exceptions are
thrown you can test this to by wrapping your code in try catch braces and
using fail notify yourself of the test failure.  The CookBook supplied with
Junit should be enough to get you started.
 
Good luck.  James.
